result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarriel Demont Cotton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.02(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
-  Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
-  Court waives the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges as defendant has no source of income
-  Pay the DNA surcharge during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
if confinement is served -  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
-  COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

-  Defendant to be supervised by the Mental Health unit
-  Continue all treatment and/or therapy as recommended (including any in-patient treatment or therapy)
-  Take all medications as prescribed
-  Residence with defendant's mother - unless mother and probation agent object

charges.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jarriel Demont Cotton

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Invoice forwarded to accounts payable in the amount of $875.00 to Dr. John Pankiewicz for services on 07/06, 07/24/2015, 07/07/2015, 07/27, 07/28/2015. Copy in file.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by Janette C., the State and defense counsel.  

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  10 years with  356 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  5 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  5 years.  
COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  4  years.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-  Defendant to be supervised by the Mental Health unit
-  Continue all treatment and/or therapy as recommended (including any in-patient treatment or therapy)
-  Take all medications as prescribed
-  Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
-  Residence with defendant's mother - unless mother and probation agent object
-  Court waives the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges as defendant has no source of income
-  Pay the DNA surcharge during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  Defendant to be supervised by the Mental Health unit
-  Continue all treatment and/or therapy as recommended (including any in-patient treatment or therapy)
-  Take all medications as prescribed
-  Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
-  Residence with defendant's mother - unless mother and probation agent object
-  Court waives the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges as defendant has no source of income
-  Pay the DNA surcharge during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
if confinement is served -  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant to be turned over to mother for release from custody.

Defendant Jarriel Demont Cotton in court with Attorney Eugene Bykhovsky.  Defendant Jarriel Demont Cotton in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count  1:
Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

As to Count  2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Count  2   DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
Clerk:  jms

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eugene Bykhovsky in court, defendant Jarriel Demont Cotton not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case could not be heard on today's date due to court calendar congestion.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eugene Bykhovsky in court, defendant Jarriel Demont Cotton not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of today's hearing.
All parties review the doctor's report.  State and Defense do not challenge the report.  
There being no challenges to the report by the State, defense counsel or defendant, the Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense, but if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within the statutory time frame.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   
Court orders further review hearing and case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms
Report from Mendota Mental Health dated November 25, 2015 received and filed.
filed and signed by the Court.

BRANCH 26 FOR 21.  Defendant Jarriel Demont Cotton in court with attorney Eugene Bykhovsky.  Defendant Jarriel Demont Cotton in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for Doctor's report return.  Defendant found not competent and is more likely than not to become competent within the permissible time frame if provided with remediation and treatment at at state psychiatric institute.  Defense counsel does not challenge the report.  The Court ordered defendant be commited to a state institution for treatment.    Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 21.  Review hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eugene Bykhovsky in court, defendant Jarriel Demont Cotton not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody not in Court.  Matter adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report for when ADA Carmody is in Court.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Bykhovsky does not appear.  Two telephone message left for Attorney Bykhovsky with no return call.  Matter reset for Monday, September 14, 2015 @ 1:30 p.m. for Doctor's Report Return.
From Dr. Collins/Hernke received and filed.
Signed and filed.  Copy of Order, previous NGI examination and complaint forwarded to the Forensic Unit

Defendant Jarriel Demont Cotton in court with attorney Eugene Bykhovsky.  Defendant Jarriel Demont Cotton in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense raises competency.  Defendant has stopped taking his meds.  Court suspends proceedings and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit for competency.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Bykhovsky in Court indicated that defendant has stopped taking medications.  Matter scheduled for Hearing to address this issue.

Attorney Eugene Bykhovsky in court, defendant Jarriel Demont Cotton not in court, in custody.  Megan Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense went over the report submitted by Dr.  Pankiewicz.  Defendant is not contesting the findings in this report.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Eugene Bykhovsky in court, defendant Jarriel Demont Cotton not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin. From Dr. John Pankiewicz received and filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE RETURN ON DOCTOR'S REPORT.

Attorney Eugene Bykhovsky in court, Defendant Jarriel Demont Cotton not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The doctor needs a copy of a statement in order to complete the evaluation.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
From Dr. Pankiewicz indicating that his report will not be ready for the court date of 7/21/2015

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty by reason of insanity. Order for Examination under 971.61 signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 21.

Defendant Jarriel Demont Cotton in court with attorney Eugene Bykhovsky.  Defendant Jarriel Demont Cotton in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for return on doctors report. Parties have reviewed the report. Defense counsel does not contest the findings. Court reinstated the proceedings and the previously set bail.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE RETURN OF DOCT'R REPORT HEARING IN BRANCH 21.

Defendant Jarriel Demont Cotton in court, in custody (bull pen).  Michael Jerome Lonski for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense never appeared in court. Defense never called the court.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
From Dr. Pankiewicz received and filed

Defendant Jarriel Demont Cotton in court with attorney Eugene Bykhovsky.  Defendant Jarriel Demont Cotton in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JANETTE C., JAMARLOWE C., JENNIFER C., AND J.C. (3/12/98).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jarriel Demont Cotton in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Jarriel Demont Cotton in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
